Key Arguments: The bill is seen as a totalitarian assault on freedom of speech.
It gives excessive power to the government and media companies, potentially destroying free and open debate.
There is concern that moral and religious views, particularly those of Christians, may be censored.
The legislation could target independent schools and limit their ability to teach freely.
The author is skeptical of the government's intentions, drawing from personal experience in a Communist country.
The bill is perceived as a tool to maintain the political status quo and suppress dissent.
Past government actions during Covid-19 are cited as examples of harmful censorship.
The author believes that the proposed legislation could lead to prolonged harmful policies, as seen in other countries.
Main Themes: Historical and Personal Experience with Censorship
Notable Quotes: This bill is essentially a totalitarian assault on freedom of speech.
As Christian I hold different views regarding moral values that may be censored or removed from public debate as a result of the proposed changes.
As someone born in a Communist country where information was tightly regulated and mistruths propagated by the government, I am highly sceptical the powers granted will achieve anything good.
During Covid 19 many Citizens and professional medical staff were censored by Government. 4,200 posts were removed as misinformation, but most of them were true as we know now.
